title: Microsoft briefly overtakes Apple
text: Premium NEW YORK CITY: Microsoft briefly dethroned its rival Apple to become the world's most valuable company on Thursday, illustrating the contrast between a firm driven by artificial intelligence (AI) and another whose iPhone sales are a cause for concern. Shortly after markets opened on Wall Street, the value of the Windows operating system creator reached a market capitalization of almost $2.9 trillion, slightly above Apple, according to calculations made by Agence France-Presse (AFP). Ad-free access
